conclusion: To determine the final positions where A and B will stop, we need to analyze the movements, collisions, and deflections observed in the sequence of images.
A (pink car) starts from the left side, moving towards the right.
B (green car) starts from the right side, moving towards the left.
A collides with the yellow cube, changing direction slightly and continuing rightward.
B collides with the purple cube and then the yellow cube, changing direction and moving towards the center.
A continues moving right after the collision with the yellow cube.
B, after colliding with the yellow cube, moves towards the center of the area.
A eventually moves out of the visible area to the right.
B continues moving leftward and eventually moves out of the visible area to the left.
Final Answer: A (pink car) stops outside the visible area to the right. B (green car) stops outside the visible area to the left.
